newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Howard says he and Costello agree on Senate.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Howard says he and Costello agree on Senate.

text.p: Australian Prime Minister John Howard said on Friday he and Treasurer Peter Costello had agreed that a substantially amended welfare bill should be returned to the upper house of parliament, the Senate, for reconsideration.
"I'll just take the opportunity of saying that reports in this morning's papers that I, in some way, overruled the treasurer in what he said is not true," Howard told reporters.
"I knew he was going to make that statement. We agreed that he should make it."
But Howard said returning the bill to the Senate did not mean the government was angling for an early election.
The government can call a double dissolution election if the Senate rejects a bill twice.
"I don't want an early election ... but we will do what we can to get our legislation through," Howard said.
"It was just a simple statement of what we're going to do and I say again don't start reading early elections into it."
The Senate substantially amended the social security bill on Tuesday, in a move which Costello has said will cost the budget A$400 million over the next four years.
